awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  Distributed Ledger Technology Based Collaborative Project Management Platform
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is to improve the performance and accountability of capital projects which have significant economic and social impact. Large capital projects, such as infrastructure and energy, have long-term benefits to economies, affect local communities, and have geopolitical implications. Projects in important sectors such as defense, science, and healthcare often suffer massive cost and time overruns, making efficient and verifiable project execution highly beneficial. These projects are very complex and challenging to manage; they require multiple internal stakeholders to work together and affect many external communities. The proposed solution is a platform that enables self-regulating project networks and integrates schedules, contracts, and information flow across companies. This platform will be based on distributed ledger technology and smart contracts, making them transparent, efficient, and secure. The proposed solution will create a new, reliable, measurable paradigm for capital projects and allow multiple companies to collaboratively plan and collectively build them. It will also aid regulatory oversight, and projects will include all stakeholders. The platform will be revolutionary for complex projects planning and building, significantly improving cost and schedule performance, and bringing greater accountability to the multi-trillion dollar capital project market.

This SBIR Phase I project proposes to develop a platform using blockchain technology that improves the performance and accountability of capital projects. The technology will enable significantly improved transparency, while making projects more cost and schedule efficient. The platform will result in more responsive and responsible symbiotic project ecosystems and advance the application of directed, acyclic, graph based distributed ledger technology to multi-party enterprise workflows. The collaborative governance platform will enable self-regulating project networks of authenticated stakeholders, utilizing a consensus-based single-source-of-truth, and automate contract execution and value exchange. The platform will synchronize schedules, contracts, and payments into one system with verifiable consensus across all participants. The technology will incentivize project performance by mitigating the effects of complexity and enable artificial intelligence and machine learning applications for projects by providing verifiable data. The focus will be on developing the architecture and business model of the platform.  The team will conduct market research to identify the primary commercial consumers and potential revenue streams. The project will build a proof-of-concept to demonstrate the feasibility of the platform. The anticipated results include a functional prototype of the platform and a validated business model.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The SBIR Phase I project, under award number 2230205, marks a pioneering step towards revolutionizing the management of complex capital projects through Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT). This groundbreaking research aims to significantly enhance the performance, accountability, and transparency of large-scale projects, which are foundational to economic growth and social well-being. The project introduces a novel, DLT-based collaborative platform to address the chronic challenges of cost and time overruns in sectors critical to national interests—such as infrastructure, energy, defense, science, and healthcare. This platform promises to transform how projects are planned, executed, and regulated, ensuring they meet their timelines, budgets, and societal goals.

The core innovation lies in the platform's ability to enable distributed, collaborative governance across project networks, integrating schedules, contracts, and information flows across participating companies with transparency and efficiency. The platform ensures that all transactions and interactions are secure, verifiable, and executed in real-time, fostering a new level of trust and collaboration among stakeholders by leveraging smart contracts and blockchain technology. This approach mitigates the complexities inherent in multi-party projects and opens avenues for regulatory oversight and inclusive stakeholder participation, thereby enhancing the overall integrity and success rates of capital projects. This addresses the problem of principal-agent issues and fractured workflows and information, which are known to be critical issues that affect project performance. Projects also become more transparent and auditable, making them more responsible and also serving as reliable data for planning future projects in similar sectors.

Throughout the Phase I project, significant strides were made in developing the platform's architecture, validating it, and demonstrating its feasibility through a functional prototype. We successfully built and tested a comprehensive suite of smart contracts written for the robust and well supported Ethereum ecosystem. These contracts are designed to automate and secure various aspects of project management, from initiating and tracking project milestones to managing contracts and payments between parties. This innovative approach leverages blockchain technology to ensure transparency, efficiency, and security in collaborative project management. This translates our architecture of modeling a multi-party project as a connected set of milestone smart contracts into a deployable product. Smart contracts translate the contractual terms, including roles, responsibilities, completion dates, and payments, to a form that is verifiable and referenceable by the companies involved in a project milestone and automatically executable.

A client web application at each company serves as an advanced project management software. The application enables individual companies to connect and interact with other companies involved in the project using DLT. It uses smart contracts to connect and synchronize key milestones, often involving payments and critical tasks, with other companies. The project management application is powerful in of itself. It incorporates a graph database to support detailed project scheduling. This database facilitates mapping project tasks, complex dependencies, and timelines, offering a dynamic and interactive visualization of the project's progress. The use of a graph database is particularly effective in managing complex projects with multiple interdependencies, as it provides a clear overview of the project structure and progress. We integrated advanced data analytics and machine learning algorithms to analyze project data, enabling predictive insights into project timelines, cost overruns, and potential risks. This capability allows project managers to make informed decisions quickly and mitigate issues before they escalate. Integrated project dashboards, designed to provide a trusted view of project information for all stakeholders are built into the application integrating information from the database for an individual company's detailed schedule with the information from the overall project through DLT. The dashboards aggregate data from various sources, including the smart contracts and graph database, to present a comprehensive overview of project status, milestones, and key performance indicators.

The research and development efforts have laid a robust foundation for the subsequent phases, aiming to refine the platform's features, optimize its smart contract capabilities, integrate it effectively, and make it market-ready. The anticipated broader impacts of this innovation are profound, offering a reliable, measurable paradigm shift in managing capital projects. By improving cost efficiency, schedule adherence, and stakeholder accountability, the platform stands to revolutionize the multi-trillion dollar capital project market, aligning closely with NSF's mission to advance the progress of science and contribute to the nation's welfare.


Last Modified: 02/27/2024
Modified by: Ananth Natarajan
